django.views.generic.dates

Classes

YearMixin

Mixin for views manipulating year-based data.

MonthMixin

Mixin for views manipulating month-based data.

DayMixin

Mixin for views manipulating day-based data.

WeekMixin

Mixin for views manipulating week-based data.

DateMixin

Mixin class for views manipulating date-based data.

BaseDateListView

Abstract base class for date-based views displaying a list of objects.

BaseArchiveIndexView

Base class for archives of date-based items. Requires a response mixin.

ArchiveIndexView

Top-level archive of date-based items.

BaseYearArchiveView

List of objects published in a given year.

YearArchiveView

List of objects published in a given year.

BaseMonthArchiveView

List of objects published in a given month.

MonthArchiveView

List of objects published in a given month.

BaseWeekArchiveView

List of objects published in a given week.

WeekArchiveView

List of objects published in a given week.

BaseDayArchiveView

List of objects published on a given day.

DayArchiveView

List of objects published on a given day.

BaseTodayArchiveView

List of objects published today.

TodayArchiveView

List of objects published today.

Detail view of a single object on a single date; this differs from the

get_year_format()[source]

Get a year format string in strptime syntax to be used to parse the year from url variables.

get_year()[source]

Return the year for which this view should display data.

get_next_year(date)[source]

Get the next valid year.

get_previous_year(date)[source]

Get the previous valid year.

class django.views.generic.dates.DateMixin[source]

Mixin class for views manipulating date-based data.

date_field = None[source]
allow_future = False[source]
get_date_field()[source]

Get the name of the date field to be used to filter by.

get_allow_future()[source]

Return True if the view should be allowed to display objects from the future.

uses_datetime_field()[source]

Return True if the date field is a DateTimeField and False if it’s a DateField.

class django.views.generic.dates.BaseDateListView[source]

Bases: django.views.generic.list.MultipleObjectMixin, DateMixin, django.views.generic.base.View

Abstract base class for date-based views displaying a list of objects.

allow_empty = False[source]
date_list_period = 'year'[source]
get(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]
abstractmethod get_dated_items()[source]

Obtain the list of dates and items.

get_ordering()[source]

Return the field or fields to use for ordering the queryset; use the date field by default.

get_dated_queryset(**lookup)[source]

Get a queryset properly filtered according to allow_future and any extra lookup kwargs.

get_date_list_period()[source]

Get the aggregation period for the list of dates: ‘year’, ‘month’, or ‘day’.

get_date_list(queryset, date_type=None, ordering='ASC')[source]

Get a date list by calling queryset.dates/datetimes(), checking along the way for empty lists that aren’t allowed.

class django.views.generic.dates.BaseDateDetailView[source]

Bases: YearMixin, MonthMixin, DayMixin, DateMixin, django.views.generic.detail.BaseDetailView

Detail view of a single object on a single date; this differs from the standard DetailView by accepting a year/month/day in the URL.

get_object(queryset=None)[source]

Get the object this request displays.
